review_text: Such a holy place.  It is very silent and solemn. Although there a lot of people, you know everyone values sanctity and piety. A good place to find peace and self-reproach. There are accommodating areas for visitors.  Natural and beautiful ‚Ä¶

While we were in Simala in Cebu, a good friend suggested that we also visit the Shrine of Bishop Camomot in Carcar.  He will be the 3rd Filipino saint if he will be Canonized in the Vatican. This is a nice destination for Catholics. ‚Ä¶
It was a place where incorruptible body of Blessed Archbishop Teofilo Camomot can be located. It's a Holy Ground and suitable for meditation and contemplation.
Nice and quiet place for reverence
A place that you will prayer to be come saint Filipino and your indulgence self
Very sacred, peaceful and beautiful place to visit.

My father returned to the shrine because of answered prayers through the intercession of Bishop Camomot.  This is my first time to visit but I felt the holiness of the place.  There's a public restroom, store, and resting area.  There's ‚Ä¶

His undying love for the poor is just one of the virtues of the servant of GOD, bishop Camomot.  The shrine is helpful to us Christians seeking for GOD's grace through the intercession of late bishop Camomot. Bishop Camomot, Pray for usüôè ‚Ä¶
A perfect place for prayer and meditation.  In this place we ask Archbishop Camomot to intercede for us and that God my hear our prayers!!!
Few area is still under renovation but very relaxing and informational for the life of Archbishop T Camomot.

Solemn place to worship and reflect oneself. Has wide open parking spaces, canteen, souvenir shop and a decent place to eat and restrooms without being worried if you're gonna be charged. Just clean as you go. Masses are held near the adjacent chapel too.
This shrine keeps getting better every time I come visit.
I was glad the remains of Blessed Teofilo Camomot were transformed to a bigger chapel at the back. The chapel has pictures and memorabilias of this holy man. It is airconditioned. ‚Ä¶

Also known as Domus Teofilo, is a solemn place to honor the good archbishop Teofelo Camomot. Opens everyday at 8am - 4:30pm but I believe they are close at noon time. There is a Eucharistic celebration every Saturday at 10am. ‚Ä¶
the burial place of archbishop teofilo camomot and also there's a mini museum in this place, you can see his bed his wristwatch his chair and many more.

It's very nice, quiet way, many shops, is it money, it would be good and stay like that place that is simple and comfortable but beautiful.
